channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Coronavirus: Most of 1,016 new cases are in dorms; 84-year-old is 12th death
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

Foreign workers in dormitories continue to drive the rise in new coronavirus cases in Singapore, while there are signs that unlinked cases here are falling, going by updates from the Ministry of Health (MOH) last night.

item.title: SPH, AsiaOne launch new digital content for circuit breaker period
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore Press Holdings (SPH) has launched a website that covers a wide variety of video content to keep people entertained during the circuit breaker period.

item.title: Masks shouldn't be seen as only form of protection
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

Two months ago, the Government urged people to wear masks only if they were feeling unwell.

item.title: Coronavirus: 4,500 bedding items for isolation facilities arrive from Indonesia
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

About 4,500 bedding items have been delivered to Singapore from Indonesia to cater to Covid-19 community isolation facilities here, such as Singapore Expo.

item.title: CAG eyes air cargo amid plunge in passenger flights
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

Cargo planes are now taking to the skies and landing at Changi Airport more often to make up for the shortfall caused by the plunge in passenger flights.

item.title: Elective procedures stopped at hospitals as patient load increases
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

Elective medical procedures have been completely stopped at hospitals as the healthcare system is under increasing strain from large numbers of Covid-19 patients.

item.title: SAF, Home Team extend basic training suspension
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

The Singapore Armed Forces (SAF) and the Home Team have extended the suspension of basic training until June 1, in line with the Government's circuit breaker measures to curb the spread of Covid-19.

item.title: SIA to deploy more passenger planes to carry cargo only
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

A few more Singapore Airlines (SIA) planes will soon be flying with cargo instead of people secured in passenger seats, after a first such flight was completed earlier this month.

item.title: Coronavirus: F&B outlets give away food to charities
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

Food and beverage operators given just a few hours' notice that they would have to shut by yesterday have been scrambling to clear their inventory of sweet treats, snacks and other perishables.

item.title: Call to make a healthy, natural environment a basic human right
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

The world's attention may have been attuned to the wildlife trade amid the global outbreak of Covid-19, the start of which has been traced to a market selling live animals in China.

item.title: Virus cases cross 10,000; experts see tough battle ahead
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

Coronavirus infections in Singapore crossed the 10,000 mark yesterday, as experts told The Straits Times that the numbers could potentially rise dramatically over the next few days, with the country locked in battle with a "smart" virus that is able to exploit any weak links in the system.

item.title: Covid-19 superheroes: Creator under fire quits community artist group
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

In the latest twist to Singapore's Covid-19 superhero saga, the creator of the ill-fated Virus Vanguard has quit the community artist group he founded after online chatter surfaced suggesting he might have copied the work of other artists.

item.title: Coronavirus: Thinner crowds at popular markets where entry is determined by NRIC
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

A new move to restrict entry to popular wet markets based on the last digit of shoppers' NRIC number resulted in thinner crowds yesterday morning.

item.title: Worksites could pose dengue risk at this time
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

As construction projects across the island have ground to a halt since the start of the circuit breaker measures about two weeks ago, residents have expressed concern that the idle worksites near their homes might now be hot spots for dengue transmission.

item.title: Six taken to court over a range of offences, including assault
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

A man who was caught on video allegedly verbally abusing a store supervisor with vulgarities and racist remarks was among six people taken to a district court yesterday over a range of charges in separate incidents amid the coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: SMC asks two doctors not to contact female patients outside of work
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

The Singapore Medical Council (SMC) said it has asked two doctors accused of taking advantage of vulnerable patients for sex to refrain from contacting their female patients outside of work.

item.title: Crowds at Geylang Serai market down to less than half: Masagos
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

The crowd at Geylang Serai market shrunk to less than half yesterday, the first day that new measures to improve safe distancing kicked in at popular markets, said Environment and Water Resources Minister Masagos Zulkifli.

item.title: askST: My son is stressed out, anxiety-ridden in top school
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

Both my husband and I were overjoyed when our youngest son, who emerged as the top pupil in a neighbourhood primary school, made it to a top Integrated Programme school.

item.title: 150 caught flouting safe distancing rules; over 50 didn't wear masks
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

About 150 people were caught flouting safe distancing measures, while more than 50 did not wear a mask outside their homes yesterday.

item.title: Lost a limb at 28 and now strives to help others like him walk again
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

In his dream, Mr Muhammad Fazli Hasri was in a white car spinning around in a washing machine.

item.title: Coronavirus: Timing of school holidays not ideal but parents realise need
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

The timing of this year's school holidays will not be ideal for families stuck at home, parents said.

item.title: Record $8.1b in bets placed on lotteries, sports
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

Fuelled by a spike in bets during the 2018 World Cup, a record $8.1 billion was wagered on lotteries and sports betting in the financial year that ended in March last year, according to the Tote Board.

item.title: Flexible healthcare system needed to tackle 'smart' virus
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

The outbreak of Covid-19 is caused by a "smart" virus unlike any other, unique in its ability to infect humans and cause disease, a panel of experts said yesterday, adding that it was important for the healthcare system to be flexible so it can take on new challenges that the outbreak will pose.

item.title: Coronavirus: Workers given assurances on pay, food, medical treatment
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

Foreign workers who are confined to their dormitories for the next two weeks can rest assured that their salaries will be paid and their food and medical needs will be attended to, Minister for Home Affairs K. Shanmugam said yesterday.

item.title: Circuit breaker could lead to virtual hearings in long term
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

The Covid-19 pandemic has hastened the Singapore courts to take measures that will help ensure hearings can proceed and decisions can be taken without holding physical court sessions, unless it is a must.

item.title: Coronavirus: New dorm cases to remain high as authorities focus on weak link
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

New daily cases of Covid-19 at foreign worker dormitories will remain high for many weeks to come, infectious diseases experts said yesterday.

item.title: Coronavirus: Workers worried about virus, but also about work, wages
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

Staying in a dormitory room all day can be tiresome but for construction worker Muthukrishnan Manivannan, his day is spent worrying about his family back in India.

item.title: New training academies in prisons to help inmates establish careers
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

Prison inmates here will have access to specialist training programmes such as precision engineering classes and media skills training, to help them establish a career after their release.

item.title: Circuit breaker is working but not as fast as hoped: Experts
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

The circuit breaker measures are working - but not as fast as hoped for, said Professor Teo Yik Ying, dean of the NUS Saw Swee Hock School of Public Health.

item.title: I still don't know who passed virus to me: Worker who is in hospital
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

Fearing that the conditions of his living quarters could increase his risk of coronavirus infection, Mr Mohan, 34, volunteered to help clean up the S11 Dormitory @ Punggol which was suddenly locked down on April 5.

item.title: Ciggies packed with frozen fish, dumped at Tuas coast
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

Cartons of duty-unpaid cigarettes hidden in boxes of frozen fish, or sealed in trash bags and tossed into the sea at night to be retrieved later.

item.title: Usefulness of testing population for antibodies unclear
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore has been actively testing people with respiratory symptoms and close contacts of Covid-19 patients for the coronavirus.

item.title: Safety measures will still be needed after June 1: Masagos
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

Life cannot go back to normal straight after the circuit breaker lifts and safety precautions must still be observed to stop the spread of Covid-19, said Minister-in-Charge of Muslim Affairs Masagos Zulkifli yesterday.

item.title: NTU relief package to help students in need due to Covid-19
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

Nanyang Technological University (NTU) has launched a private philanthropic programme to help its students, with university president Subra Suresh and his wife, Mrs Mary Suresh, making a personal gift of $100,000 to seed and anchor the fund.

item.title: Still no effective treatment for virus: Experts
item.description:
April 23, 2020 5:00 AM

There is still no good treatment for Covid-19, said infectious diseases experts from the two public institutions that have cared for the largest number of infected patients here.
